Sentencas: Hexavalent chromium species like the oxyhydroxide, CrO(2)(OH)(2), or hexoxide, CrO(3), are electrochemically reduced to Cr(2)O(3) in solid oxide fuel cells and adversely affect the cell operating potentials.
Titulo: The Effect of Chromium Oxyhydroxide on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Using a narrowly focused beam from the Advanced Photon Source, such chromium oxide deposits were unequivocally identified in the active region of the cathode by X-ray diffraction, suggesting that the triple phase boundaries were partially blocked.
Titulo: The Effect of Chromium Oxyhydroxide on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Under fuel cell operating conditions, the reaction has an equilibrium potential of about 0.9 V and the rate of chromium oxide deposition is therefore dependent on the operating potential of the cell.
Titulo: The Effect of Chromium Oxyhydroxide on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It becomes diffusion limited after several hours of steady operation.
Titulo: The Effect of Chromium Oxyhydroxide on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: At low operating potentials, lanthanum manganite cathodes begin to be reduced to MnO, which reacts with the chromium oxide to form the MnCr(2)O(4) spinel.
Titulo: The Effect of Chromium Oxyhydroxide on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
